content:
The other root in the example equation x^3 - 3x^2 + 2x - 1 = 0 is a complex root. The cubic equation has 3 roots, but since the equation x^3 - 3x^2 + 2x - 1 = 0 does not have any real solutions for x^2, the discriminant of the equation is negative, which means the solutions will be complex. In the example I provided, the solutions were found by factoring the equation into the product of two linear factors (x - 1)(x + 2) = 0, and solving for the roots. Since a linear equation only has real solutions, the complex root is not shown in that way.

Another way to find the roots of a cubic equation is to use the Cardano's method. Cardano's method will give you the three roots of the equation, including the complex roots.

In this case, the other root will be a complex number, which can be represented in the form of x = a + bi, where a and b are real numbers and i is the imaginary unit, which is defined as the square root of -1. The two solutions provided in the previous example are real solutions, while the third one is a complex number.
